title: Welcome

author: Iztok Kosem, Trojina – Institute for Applied Slovene Studies

segmentation: Well, first of all, welcome to Elect's 2011, the second Conference on Electronic Lexicography.
Just for summary of our aims, we decided to come to the organize this conference because.

Because of the interest in the first conference, first of all, which was held in Van Lenovo and the interest came from both members of academia and representatives on the industry and that interest showed that such an event is sorely needed, namely event where lexicographers case discussed discussed current projects and topical issues.
An electronic lexicography.
Now the team of this conference, we decided to give it a title.
New applications for new users with specific aim for.
Turning the discussion towards the users of two types.
First of all, their dictionary users and they use online dictionaries.
They use dictionary applications, so these are the modern users we want to address.
These dictionaries users are putting new demands on dictionary publishers.
They want to click, they want to tap.
They want to slide.
They want to do all these new normal things and they also expect very often free content, quick access to all sorts of information.
They expect different features.
And the dictionary makers have to answer all these demands.
And so the question nowadays is not.

There's no longer this question of whether the electronic format should replace the paper format, or because somewhere in some place that has already happened, but it's more the question of how should we utilize all the advantages of the electronic format to make the modern dictionaries as user friendly as possible?
Now these this is the one group of users.
The other group, just as important, are lexicographers themselves.
Full prior getting bigger and bigger so there's more data to analyze.
Because of different domains from different types of users, there's.
There are new features to two devices.
There's new ways of data to present.
That have to be invented.
So the lexicographers need new tools that will help them at least automate at least some of the procedures that they face.
So specially the procedures that require little or no human intervention.

And so to tell you also to tell us something about our Institute, the organizer, Trina Institute for Applied Slowing Studies is an Institute with an objective of conducting applied a goal oriented research.
Into contemporary slowing language and its use.
And our researchers are working in the areas of lexicography, corpus linguistics, and that involves the building of core prime, the use of Corporation pedagogy, and for various other purposes.
Authorship, Attribution, terminology, extraction, and translation.
And currently we are involved in a project communication in slowing which started in 2008 and finishes in 2013 and the project will develop.
GNU corpus tools.
For Slovene corpora of slowing lexical database.
Online grammar and.
Styleguide so.
Just to return back to the conference, I think I shouldn't.
I would like to thank first and foremost our.

Endemic partners you relax and Metanet metanet is has kindly provided us with the recording of various sessions, keynotes, and all the sessions in the blue hole, which I think will be very useful to many participants.
Because when you have parallel sessions, you often tend to miss some of the sessions that you would like to attend because they happen at the same time.
Also would like to thank our main sponsors.
In Lansing, Media publishing, lexical computing and Abby Ann are supporting sponsors.
Canon Dictionaries, Oxford University Press, HTC and Huesca Dot SI, or which is the distributor of Apple devices.
Now, one of the things related to lexical computing.
They kindly provided us with a three month free trial.
While available to all, the participants at the conference, so normally you have it, you get a 330 day free trial.
They kindly.
Try to three month free trial so you simply have to go to this website.
And just one word of warning, you have to select site license member.
And then in the under the organization you select elects 2011.
And most importantly.
Under the organization, you need to type Julian Alps.
And I think Adam for making this password very slow moving.
If you forget these instructions, please contact one of the organizing committee members and we will be glad to provide it all again for you.
Awesome.
I would like to thank our keynote speakers for accepting the invitation to give a talk at the conference, and I'd like to thank the.
Programming Committee for doing the views of the abstract on such short notice, and.
Also, the Compass Hotel for providing the venue and logistical support.
And on a personal note, I would like to thank all the organizing committee members for their help and advice during the preparations.
Um?
Now why?
All the things.
I mentioned that earlier later 'cause I have it on the slide.
Just some of the housekeeping we had.
We already had three changes to the program.
Carolina friends so this this is today's today's changes.
She had to cancel her presentation due to illness.
She sends her apologies.
Her paper will still be published.
So if you're interested in her topic, read the proceedings.
Also, we hide and ya know, Timothy Mormons talk or hide is on his way here, but he will come later in the afternoon.
So we decided to move his talk to tomorrow, 1430 in the rat hole.
And because of this sort of changing program, we also decided to move by officials talk to this main Hall.
Just to allow us to have more space so that officials talk has not been moved to any other time slot.
Just the difference in holes.
And our information.
Points, so for any questions during the conference, please come to the second floor where we have our conference room.
Some of you have discovered it already and we welcome you at any point during the conference note about gala dinner.
We have a yellow note in your name tag just reminding you that you have registered for the gala dinner and it's tomorrow at 7:00 PM and we will depart.
So whoever wants to join us together from the hotel 6:45.
If there's anything wrong with the receipts and certificates of attendance, please email us at the conference address or common.
See common in the second floor.
Um?
With regards to.
Airport transfer, they reminded us that some of you didn't book the transfer for the flight back.
If you haven't done that yet, no panic.
You just have to book in advance.
So don't book taxi on the day you do it by email.
The instructions are on the website so, but use the code, elect 2011.
Or we provided a list that you can sign your name on the list on the noticeboard in the reception Hall.
And.
And we'll arrange it for you.
Now some some notes about the exhibition.
Displayed items are not for sale, so the Oxford books, the these nice gadgets provided by Apple and also by we have tablet computers and mobile phones from HTC.
They are not on sale but their representatives.
Can provide you and perhaps bring you a copy of the book or the device that you can buy.
Abbott has their representatives here as well, so you have to ask them whether some things are for sale, but I think they are an we have some more own books for sale.
Although they are available only in slow moving.
We have a 20% conference discount and just ask Carmen if you want to purchase the books now.
I mentioned this device is provided by HTC and Apple.
We're very glad that they were kind enough to provide them.
What we did was we contacted some of the participants.
Sponsors and on these devices you will find their dictionary applications links to their websites.

So if you hear any mention of any website or dictionary app during the talk and you find it of interest or you just want to test them during the coffee break or at anytime during the conference, they are available down in the cafeteria and you can test the devices, play around with them, comment, give feedback to.
The representatives and I also as representatives of.
The.
Publia the companies that authored the applications to be nearby for any questions they can provide.
Um, let's thanks for the introduction.
